name: unchronicled
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not recorded, especially in writing: It's an event that is virtually unchronicled by historians. Nowadays, there is hardly any moment of a celebrity's life that goes unchronicled.
More examplesFewer examplesThe work sheds light on the unchronicled darker recesses of Australia's history. He leaves his personal life unchronicled after 1981.Both drew from their own experience to illuminate important but largely unchronicled worlds.This was a very rich period in the city's intellectual history, which remains unchronicled. She creates a vivid portrait of a largely unchronicled corner of the world.
